India.description: A land of spirituality, vibrant festivals, and diverse landscapes.
India.culture: Respect elders by touching their feet. Remove shoes before entering homes or temples.
India.food: Butter Chicken, Masala Dosa, Biryani, Pani Puri.
India.rules: Avoid public displays of affection. Dress modestly at religious sites.

France.description: The heart of art, fashion, and world-class cuisine.
France.culture: Greet with a 'Bonjour' before asking questions. Handshakes are common.
France.food: Croissants, Coq au Vin, Macarons, Baguettes.
France.rules: It is polite to say 'Au revoir' when leaving a shop. Tipping is not mandatory but appreciated.

Japan.description: Where ancient traditions blend seamlessly with futuristic technology.
Japan.culture: Bowing is the traditional greeting. Silence is golden on public transport.
Japan.rules: Do not tip (it's considered rude). Take off shoes indoors. Do not eat while walking.

Brazil.description: Home to the Amazon, Samba, and the world's biggest carnival.
Brazil.culture: People are warm and physical; hugs and cheek kisses are common greetings.
Brazil.food: Feijoada, PÃ£o de Queijo, Brigadeiro, AÃ§aÃ­.
Brazil.rules: Topless sunbathing is illegal. Carry ID at all times.

Australia.description: A continent of outback adventures and stunning coastlines.
Australia.culture: 'Mateship' is central. BBQs are a serious social tradition.
Australia.food: Vegemite Toast, Meat Pies, Lamingtons, Pavlova.
Australia.rules: Swim between the flags at the beach. Tipping is not expected.

Egypt.description: The cradle of civilization with monuments that defy time.
Egypt.culture: Family is the center of social life. Hospitality is paramount.
Egypt.rules: Dress conservatively. Public affection is frowned upon. Ask before taking photos of locals.
